subject: Re: [junit] Question about the procedure for submitting code for 	consideration in the projec
msgSnippet: Hi, Tim. Thanks for looking into this.  We ve just moved our hosting over to Git, and we are Git newbies ourselves, so stay on the list so that wiser heads can
messageBody:
Hi, Tim.

Thanks for looking into this. We've just moved our hosting over to Git, and
we are Git newbies ourselves, so stay on the list so that wiser heads can
opine.

You want to produce a fork of http://github.com/KentBeck/junit with your
change, and then issue a pull request. The documentation on github is
probably better than any further advice I can produce, but please come back
with questions.

Note that we reserve the right to mull over your change before accepting it,
in the name of keeping JUnit relatively tight, feature-wise. Thanks,

David

On Fri, Feb 13, 2009 at 2:09 PM, Tim Hobson <thobson@...> wrote:

> I have implemented a solution to tracker#1565177 on the sourceforge
> site, and would be happy to feed it back into the project. Can anyone
> guide me through that process?
>
> Thanks,
